title: Zelda Cook: The Timekeeper

story.text: Zelda Cook, a meticulous event manager, finds an ancient clock in a remote section of an antique shop. Curiously, when she touches it, time momentarily stops around her.
Testing out her newfound power, Zelda pauses time to save a cat stuck in a traffic-heavy road. Amazed by the potential, she wonders how far she can take this ability.
Zelda halts an entire day to figure out her abilities. She learns she can control how long time stops but feels fatigued if used excessively.
Zelda rescues a group of people from a fire in an office building. Word begins to spread of a mysterious savior.
As Zelda masters her powers, she starts time-stopping for shorter personal gains, creating a moral conflict within her.
Zelda attends a local spiritual assembly and shares her struggles with power. Her community reminds her of the spiritual and ethical use of her abilities.
Zelda decides to use her powers only for selfless acts, solidifying her status as a true heroine. She rescues a sinking ship full of innocent people without anyone ever knowing.

ending: As days turned into nights, Zelda became a silent guardian of her city, a testament to the virtue of selfless heroism.
moral: With great power comes great responsibility.
